description: Documented security vulnerabilities that are waived from failing CI builds

waivedAdvisories.title: Arbitrary OS command injection
waivedAdvisories.reason: Cannot upgrade without breaking React 18/19 peer dependencies. Documented in SECURITY.md. Only affects development CLI, not production runtime.

waivedAdvisories.title: SSRF improper categorization in isPublic
waivedAdvisories.reason: Transitive dependency via @expo/cli. Cannot upgrade without Expo SDK upgrade. Documented in SECURITY.md.

waivedAdvisories.title: Regular Expression Denial of Service
waivedAdvisories.reason: Transitive dependency via @expo/image-utils. Cannot upgrade without Expo SDK upgrade. Documented in SECURITY.md.

waivedAdvisories.title: Template injection that can lead to XSS
waivedAdvisories.reason: Development server only. Cannot upgrade without @expo/cli upgrade. Documented in SECURITY.md.

waivedAdvisories.title: Prototype pollution in merge (<<)
waivedAdvisories.reason: Transitive dependency via @expo/cli, Jest, and Metro. Development tooling only. Cannot upgrade without Expo SDK and Jest upgrades. Documented in SECURITY.md.

notes: This file documents known vulnerabilities that are tracked in SECURITY.md
Waivers expire after expiresAfter date to force re-evaluation
New vulnerabilities not in this list will still fail CI builds
Review SECURITY.md for full context and mitigation strategies
